properties.name: Alternative route - Ferrell Road cutoff
properties.description: Posted by DougherjYou are cruising down Rt 538 to Buck Rd to get on high speed Route 55. If you are adventurous, you can make a left here at Ferrell (firehouse on the right at the intersection) and zip over to Route 55 here. This can be faster. Ferrell becomes Ellis Mill Rd but you stay on the same road for the few miles to 55. It\'s a bit longer, but you get on the high speed road sooner.

properties.name: Route 83
properties.description: Posted by DougherjVeer left onto Rt 83 for a couple of miles to Rt 9. There you make a right onto 9 south and look for the sign into Avalon. When returning from shore, check out the sign for Route 83 which indicates Camden. Route 83 runs for no more than 4 miles. Camden is 70 miles away.

properties.name: Schuykill Expressway & 'Blue Route' I-476
properties.description: Posted by DougherjTake I-476 South to I-95 South. This is the way to get to our back route to Avalon and one choice for heading to Loyola.

properties.name: Sergio's Italian Specialties
properties.description: Posted by Dougherj Written up in NY Times as a great Italian meats store. ************************** Online rvw, not Times Little Italy in Little Denville September 23, 2005 8:16 PM PST I love Denville. It\'s such a great, human-scale town. Nice people, nice atmosphere, great food. Sergio\'s is an example of what I mean. It\'s exactly like the Italian stores my mother took us to as kids. Her favorite was the Italian Food Center on Grand Street in NYC and I think Sergio can go toe to toe with that place any day. They have great home made Mozzarella. They have wonderful bread. The cold cuts are the premium brands and their salads are fresh and made in house. They have daily specials that are put up on a chalk board - just like you would if you owned a place like this. My favorite dish is a regular sandwich made with either grilled or breaded and fried chicken, mozzarella, peppers on a semolina roll (I think it\'s a number 7). My wife and i split one for lunch on Saturdays - dousing it with balsamic vinegar and washing it down with San Pelligrino. Try it, you\'ll like it.
